children.name: plan
children.definition: to think carefully about sth you are going to do, and decide how you will do it: lên kế hoạch, lập kế hoạch
examples: ▪ Sue spent months planning her trip.
▪ The burglary had obviously been very carefully planned.
plan how/what/where etc
▪ Have you planned how you’re going to spend your prize money?
plan for
▪ I think we should plan for about 50 guests.
▪ We’re planning for rain because the forecast isn’t good.
have sth plannedhave planned sth carefully already
▪ Don’t worry, I have the whole evening planned.
planning[U] B2 the activity of deciding how you will do sth that you intend to do: sự lên kế hoạch
financial/town/military etc planning
After weeks of planning, the big day finally arrived.
Increasing traffic congestion is a major influence on town planning.

children.name: make plans
children.definition: to think about and talk about sth that you intend to do, especially sth that needs to becarefullyplanned: lập kế hoạch
examples: ▪ We sat around the table, talking, laughing, and making plans.

children.name: make plans for
examples: ▪ I’ve already started to make plans for the wedding - there’s so much to do.

children.name: make arrangements
children.definition: to organize the details of an event or trip, such as the times in which things will happen: sắp xếp, xếp đặt
examples: ▪ I’d booked the flight and made all the arrangements well in advance.

children.name: make arrangements for
examples: ▪ John’s brother kindly made the arrangements for the funeral.

children.name: make arrangements with
examples: ▪ Please telephone and make arrangements with my secretary.

children.name: make arrangements to do sth
examples: ▪ Vivian and her boyfriend are making arrangements to join us in Australia.

children.name: work out U
children.definition: work outespecially UK/figure outUS  to thinkcarefullyabout how you are going to do sth, especially sthcomplicatedordifficult, and plan a good way of doing it: hình dung ra, phác thảo ra
examples: ▪ Management consultant Peter Brant worked out the schedule in October 1983.
▪ UN negotiators have figured out a plan which they hope will be acceptable to both sides.

children.name: work/figure out a way of doing something
examples: ▪ The first thing you’ll have to do is figure out a way of earning the money.

children.name: work out what/where/how etc
examples: ▪ I’ll certainly go back to my job once I’ve worked out who’s going to look after the kids during the day.

children.name: have it all worked/figured outhave completely planned how you are going to do something
examples: ▪ The killer, whoever he was, had it all worked out.

children.name: map out
children.definition: to plan all the details of how sth is going to develop in the future, especially over a long period of time: phác thảo chi tiết
examples: Representatives from several European countries met to map out details of the proposed aid program.

children.name: have your future/career/education etc mapped out
examples: Jodie has her career all mapped out.
By the time he was 15, his parents already had his future mapped out.

children.name: formulate
children.definition: if members of a government, company, or other organization formulate a plan or proposal, they decide the details of what is going to be done: hình thành, lập
examples: ▪ Changes to the education system should be formulated by teachers not politicians.
formulate a plan/policy/proposal etc
▪ The government has set up a working party to formulate proposals for reducing environmental pollution.
formulation[U]
the formulation of sth
▪ A small group of advisers helps the President with the formulation of foreign policy.

children.name: mastermind
children.definition: to be the person who is in charge of planning a complicated or difficult operation, especially a crime: lên kế hoạch, cầm đầu
examples: The raid, one of the most daring crimes of the century, was masterminded by Italian playboy,Giovanni Cattani.
Well-known as a tough industrialist, he masterminded 50 company takeovers in one year.
The project was masterminded by Morris, then aged 29.
Ridley, as commerce secretary, masterminded the privatisation.

children.name: unplanned
children.definition: ▪ As a surprise, we decided to make an  visit to my mother’s.
examples: ▪ Very few burglaries are completely unplanned.
▪ Unplanned pregnancies in the US each year are estimated at 3 million.

children.name: spontaneous
children.definition: sth that is spontaneous is done because you suddenly feel you want to do it, not because you have arranged to do it or been asked to do it: tự phát
examples: ▪ The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer when the news was announced.
▪ The invitation was completely spontaneous.
▪ an act of spontaneous generosity
spontaneously[adv]
▪ It’s great when the children spontaneously show affection or appreciation.
spontaneity[U]
▪ the beauty and spontaneity of African worship

children.name: impromptu
children.definition: done or happening without any planning or preparation: “ứng khẩu”
examples: We finished the day with an impromptu game of football in a nearby field.
Jem’s impromptu speech met with thunderous applause.

children.name: not well thought out
children.definition: something that is not well thought out has not been planned carefully enough and therefore is unlikely to work well: không phác thảo kỹ lưỡng
examples: ▪ Reagan’s plan was a bold one, but it was not well thought out.
▪ If your business proposal is not very well thought out, you will find it difficult to get financial backing.

children.name: ad hoc
children.definition: not planned or organized in advance: không dự tính trước
examples: ▪ You never know when you might have to have an ad hoc meeting with a client.
▪ Historical records have often been kept in an ad hoc way, so that our information is not complete.

children.name: on an ad hoc basiswhen you need to do it, not in a planned way
examples: ▪ Most companies have some people working for them on an ad hoc basis.

children.name: planner
children.definition: sb who plans and makes important decisions about sth, especially sb whose job is to plan the way towns, governments, companies, etc grow and develop: người lập kế hoạch, nhà hoạch định
examples: ▪ The proposal will be carefully examined by a committee of executives, planners and consultants.

children.name: financial/military/environmental etc planners
examples: ▪ Economic planners fear that there will be a 5% fall in real incomes next year.

children.name: ▪ a financial planner
examples: ▪ Military planners and diplomats worry that the North’s increasing distress over food supplies could provoke it to invade the South.
Manyfinancial plannerswill help you shop for insurance.

children.name: urban/city planner
examples: City planners are looking for ways to ease traffic.

children.name: architect
children.definition: the person who originally thought of an important and successful plan, especially in politics or business: “kiến trúc sư”

children.name: the architect of sth
examples: Beveridge is usually thought of as the architect of the British National Health Service.

children.name: the chief architect of the election victory
mastermind
children.definition: a person who cleverly plans a complicated operation, especially in order to carry out a crime: kẻchủ mưu, cầm đầu
examples: ▪ The court heard that it was Mrs Thompson who was the mastermind, not her husband.

children.name: the mastermind behind/of sth
examples: ▪ Andres is the mastermind behind a huge drug-smuggling operation.

children.name: a criminal mastermind
examples: ▪ The film stars Morgan Freeman as a criminal mastermind.

children.name: to plan sth that will happen a long time in the future
plan ahead
children.definition: to plan sth that will happen a long time in the future: lên kế hoạch trước, lên kế hoạch sớm
examples: Once you have children, it’s wise to plan ahead.
Fluctuations in oil prices on the world market make it impossible for developing countries to plan ahead.

forward planningUK /future planningUS [U] B2 the activity of thinking carefully about what will happen in the future, and including this in your present plans, especially in order to make possible problems easier to deal with when the time comes:sự suytính trước
With a little more forward planning, we could have avoided these problems.
Expert advice is available for investors who wish to engage in future planning.

children.name: plan ahead for
examples: It’s never too soon to start planning ahead for your retirement.

children.name: look ahead
children.definition: to think about what may happen in the future so that you are aware of it when you make plans: tính trước, dự trù
examples: ▪ By looking ahead, management are then in a good position to anticipate potential problems.

children.name: look ahead to
examples: ▪ All footballers have to look ahead to the time when they leave the game.

children.name: planned
children.definition: đã được lên kế hoạch
examples: Some people prefer a vacation with a lot of planned activities.
The number of planned job cuts by major US businesses declined in October from a year ago.

children.name: scheduled
children.definition: planned to happen at a particular time: được lên lịch, theo lịch trình
examples: Heavy snow closed airports and forced the cancellation of scheduled budget talks at the White House.
This program will be broadcast half an hour later than the scheduled time.

children.name: scheduled to do sth
examples: A UN mission was scheduled to leave on February 29.

children.name: scheduled for
examples: The play was originally scheduled for October, but it had to be cancelled.

children.name: strategic
children.definition: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation, in order to gain an advantage against your opponents: chiến lược
examples: The British army made a strategic withdrawal across the English Channel.
The two countries agreed to join together in a strategic alliance.
UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
strategic planningmeetings
a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
strategically[adj]
Ammunition storage depots are strategically located throughout the country.
Strategically placedvideo cameras can alert police to any trouble.

children.name: well thought out
children.definition: well/carefully thought out sth that is  has been carefully planned so that it will work well and achieve its desired results: được phác thảo kỹ lưỡng
examples: If you’re planning to take a year out between school and university, it needs to be carefully thought out.
The average worker’s long-term financial security will depend upon having a well-thought-out personal finance plan.

children.name: to not try to plan things, but deal with them as they happen
take sth as it comes
children.definition: to not worry about or plan for sth that has not happened yet, but decide what to do when it happens: tới đâu hay tới đó
examples: I always think the best way of approaching an interview is to take it as it comes.

children.name: take things as they come
examples: The only way to manage when you have small kids is to take things as they come.

children.name: take life as it comes/take each day as it comes
examples: If I were you, I’d just enjoy each day and take life as it comes.

children.name: play it by ear
children.definition: to not make plans about how to deal with a particular situation, but decide to wait until it actually happens and hope that you will know what to do then: tùy cơ ứng biến

children.name: ‘Shall we tell Dad what’s happened?’ ‘Let’s play it by ear and see what sort of mood he’s in.’
examples: We’ve booked the flight, but not the accommodation -- we’ll play it by ear when we get there.

children.name: live from day to day
children.definition: to not plan very far in the future because you have too many problems now to be able to think about what may happen later: nay biết nay
examples: Since Jim got ill, we’ve just had to live from day to day.
There’s nothing as depressing as living from day to day, as the unemployed are forced to do.

children.name: one day at a time
children.definition: if you deal with a problem or difficult situation one day at a time, you try to think about just what is happening in the present and do not try to plan what you will do in the future: ngày nào lo ngày đó
examples: I’ve no idea where we’ll live. Anyway, one day at a time.

children.name: take/live one day at a time
examples: In order to overcome their addiction, they have to learn to take one day at a time.

children.name: provide for sth
children.definition: provide forsthphrasal verb
examples: tiến hành mọi sự thu xếp hoặc quyết định cóthể được thực hiện khi điều gì xảy ra; chuẩn bi
to make plans in order to deal with a possible event in the future
_We must provide for depreciation when calculating the costs.
